narratives.narrative_name: URW: Blaming the war on others rather than the invader
narratives.evidence_quote: Sadly the western media is framing the war as if Russia is losing which only prolongs negotiations and causes more death. The question is, why the desperation to keep the war going?
narratives.reasoning: This quote shifts blame for the prolongation of the war and resulting deaths onto Western media and implied Western actions, rather than attributing responsibility to Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

narratives.evidence_quote: amerika always blew any comment about RUSSIA or at later stages CHINA way out of proportion.. and you are still doing …for me …,a poor western subject.. I have NEVER agreed with you..in fact you have NEVER asked me my thoughts ….oh sorry I was / am just your cannon fodder …I do not count…
narratives.reasoning: This quote criticizes Western governments and policies, portraying them as dismissive of their citizens and manipulative, which aligns with discrediting the West.

narratives.evidence_quote: amerikans are the greatest pigs on the planet…and that is in the most derogitive term you can imagine.. absolute pigs
narratives.reasoning: The language used here is explicitly derogatory and aims to undermine the moral character of Americans and, by extension, Western nations.

narratives.evidence_quote: they are the enemy of one sort or the other.. time they took responsibility (rather than consequences) of what their politicians are doing in their name
narratives.reasoning: This quote criticizes Western politicians and implies systemic failure in Western governance, further discrediting the West.

narratives.evidence_quote: Sadly the western media is framing the war as if Russia is losing which only prolongs negotiations and causes more death... information that you are missing from the corporation propaganda western media
narratives.reasoning: This quote explicitly questions the reliability and integrity of Western media, labeling it as propaganda and untrustworthy.

narratives.evidence_quote: Will they resort to nuclear weapons to even out the war?... lets get on with a full nuke war…wipe us all out …at least it (for most) will be over quickly
narratives.reasoning: This quote evokes fear and anxiety about the potential use of nuclear weapons and the catastrophic consequences of war, aligning with the amplification of war-related fears.

narratives.narrative_name: URW: Negative Consequences for the West
narratives.evidence_quote: we deserve EVERYTHING we get... your government needs to be buried in the flames of hell..too deep to recover …every single one of them ..that means every single bureaucrat you have now
narratives.reasoning: This quote predicts and highlights adverse outcomes for Western governments and bureaucrats, suggesting they will face severe consequences for their actions.

narratives.evidence_quote: Russia is Winning, Nuclear Threat is a Sign of Desperation & Very Serious
narratives.reasoning: The title of the interview positively highlights Russia's position in the war, framing its nuclear threats as a sign of Western desperation rather than Russian aggression, which subtly praises Russia's strength.

subnarratives.subnarrative_name: URW: Blaming the war on others rather than the invader: The West are the aggressors
subnarratives.evidence_quote: for the west it’s always been the soviet (RUSSIAN) that has ALWAYS been the boogie man..when in fact they were SELDOM a threat.. amerika always blew any comment about RUSSIA or at later stages CHINA way out of proportion.. and you are still doing …for me …,a poor western subject.. I have NEVER agreed with you..in fact you have NEVER asked me my thoughts ….oh sorry I was / am just your cannon fodder …I do not count…
subnarratives.reasoning: This quote explicitly shifts blame for the conflict onto the West, portraying Russia as a victim of Western exaggeration and aggression. It aligns with the subnarrative that the West, not Russia, is the true aggressor in the war.

subnarratives.subnarrative_name: URW: Blaming the war on others rather than the invader: Other
subnarratives.evidence_quote: time to stop caring about the people that do not care..they are the enemy of one sort or the other.. time they took responsibility (rather than consequences) of what their politicians are doing in their name.. Scott Ritter ..good topics ..talking the truth..yes but where is what he says getting us …seems nowhere ..lets get on with a full nuke war…wipe us all out …at least it (for most) will be over quickly and no more of month after month of promises from Trump or threats from the east….POOF..it’s all over …thanks mostly to un-elected bureaucrats in all “western countries” they are proving the worst of the worst of humanity
subnarratives.reasoning: This segment supports the parent narrative by blaming Western bureaucrats and politicians for prolonging the war and escalating tensions, but it does not fit neatly into the predefined subnarratives. It emphasizes Western culpability in a broader, more existential sense, warranting the inclusion of 'Other'.
